current_company.title: Innovative Aircraft Design Enthusiast | Cranfield University '25 | IIT Kharagpur '22 | ISTAT | AIESEC

experience.title: Structural Design Engineer
experience.description: - I contributed to the Group Design Project, aimed at the Preliminary and Detail Design of the Aircraft Structure, airframe systems and avionic systems of the A-22 Aether civil airliner, a concept inspired by existing wide-body aircrafts (B787, A350) propelled with Liquid Hydrogen Fuel.- I designed the Engine Pylon in accordance with requirements specified in CS-25. The structural design entailed powerplant loading analysis, generating the structural layout in CATIA and performing detailed analysis to prevent failure due to bending, buckling or shear. The design was revised through Finite Element Analysis and Fatigue Analysis.- Successfully presented the design in a Critical Design Review amongst experts from Airbus, Rolls Royce, BAE Systems and the RAF.
experience.description_html: - I contributed to the Group Design Project, aimed at the Preliminary and Detail Design of the Aircraft Structure, airframe systems and avionic systems of the A-22 Aether civil airliner, a concept inspired by existing wide-body aircrafts (B787, A350) propelled with Liquid Hydrogen Fuel.- I designed the Engine Pylon in accordance with requirements specified in CS-25. The structural design entailed powerplant loading analysis, generating the structural layout in CATIA and performing detailed analysis to prevent failure due to bending, buckling or shear. The design was revised through Finite Element Analysis and Fatigue Analysis.- Successfully presented the design in a Critical Design Review amongst experts from Airbus, Rolls Royce, BAE Systems and the RAF.

experience.title: Team Leader
experience.description: - AIRAVAT is an institute-sponsored student research group aimed at conceptualizing and producing small- and large-scale prototypes of Air taxis (VTOL roadable flying vehicles). Funding has been provided by the Sponsored Research and Industrial Consultancy (SRIC), IIT Kharagpur.- Involved in the building of a working 5kg model (without payload) by implementing ground, VTOL and cruise configurations through tilt rotors. This was accomplished in coordination with the structures, propulsion and controls teams.- Led the Aerodynamics team towards CAD design and fluid flow simulation over the model body and wings with the objective of maximizing aerodynamic efficiency. Contributed towards the fabrication of the body and wing parts through hot-wire foam cutting of Styrofoam sheets.
experience.description_html: - AIRAVAT is an institute-sponsored student research group aimed at conceptualizing and producing small- and large-scale prototypes of Air taxis (VTOL roadable flying vehicles). Funding has been provided by the Sponsored Research and Industrial Consultancy (SRIC), IIT Kharagpur.- Involved in the building of a working 5kg model (without payload) by implementing ground, VTOL and cruise configurations through tilt rotors. This was accomplished in coordination with the structures, propulsion and controls teams.- Led the Aerodynamics team towards CAD design and fluid flow simulation over the model body and wings with the objective of maximizing aerodynamic efficiency. Contributed towards the fabrication of the body and wing parts through hot-wire foam cutting of Styrofoam sheets.

experience.title: Engineering Intern
experience.description: - Secured a 10-week internship at General Electric, Research Division at JFWTC, Bengaluru as part of the Thermosciences Team.- Numerically investigated the impact of ionic wind on cooling of electrical systems. Ionic wind refers to momentum transfer by corona discharge and plasma acceleration via an electric field, leading to an increase in the local flow velocity.- Applied electro-aerodynamic principles to run steady laminar two-dimensional flow-simulations across a wire-to vertical plate configuration in ANSYS FLUENT, solving Cartesian Navier-Stokes and scalar transport equations. Conducted a parametric study of the maximum flow-enhancement of the free-stream, and the convection coefficient with the electrode spacing, applied voltage and the ambient pressure.- Observed a rise in flow speed and total heat transfer with voltage at constant spacing and ambient pressure. Verified the possibility of an optimal distance of the plate from the wire. Established a linear relation between the convection coefficient and the fourth root of displacement current. Proposed methods to reduce loss in heat transfer at lower ambient pressures.
experience.description_html: - Secured a 10-week internship at General Electric, Research Division at JFWTC, Bengaluru as part of the Thermosciences Team.- Numerically investigated the impact of ionic wind on cooling of electrical systems. Ionic wind refers to momentum transfer by corona discharge and plasma acceleration via an electric field, leading to an increase in the local flow velocity.- Applied electro-aerodynamic principles to run steady laminar two-dimensional flow-simulations across a wire-to vertical plate configuration in ANSYS FLUENT, solving Cartesian Navier-Stokes and scalar transport equations. Conducted a parametric study of the maximum flow-enhancement of the free-stream, and the convection coefficient with the electrode spacing, applied voltage and the ambient pressure.- Observed a rise in flow speed and total heat transfer with voltage at constant spacing and ambient pressure. Verified the possibility of an optimal distance of the plate from the wire. Established a linear relation between the convection coefficient and the fourth root of displacement current. Proposed methods to reduce loss in heat transfer at lower ambient pressures.

positions.subtitle: AIESEC in India
positions.description: -Global Entrepreneur is a youth summer internship program which gives the participant the opportunity to develop leadership skills by working in a cross-cultural environment within a startup abroad for 6 weeks.- Drove the vision of the team, provided 5 students with global entrepreneurial internships, secured an online and offline reach of 3000 students through intern expos and digital marketing in IIT Kharagpur and NIT Jamshedpur.

projects.title: The Effect of Alternative Fuel Tanks on Blended Wing-body Conceptual Design
projects.description: - Blended Wing-body (BWB) aircrafts are concepts with the whole body acting as a lifting surface, as well as storage of payload. It benefits from tremendous aerodynamic efficiency but poses challenges in overall structural design. - Compared the impact of fuel composition (LH2 vs kerosene) on aircraft weight, drag and performance for TAW (tube-and-wing) and BWB configurations with fixed mission profile.- Evaluated the dependency of payload and range of a reference BWB concept (B-2 Spirit), on alternate LH2 fuel tank arrangements.- This was accomplished via FLOPS (Flight Optimization System), an aircraft conceptual design software developed by NASA.

projects.title: Mixing Enhancement in Scramjet Engines
projects.description: - Part of the Master's thesis under the propulsion branch of the Department of Aerospace engineering. - Thesis objective is to numerically demonstrate the effectiveness of wall-mounted pylons in addressing challenge of improving mixing of transverse-injected fuel in supersonic airflow.- Studied literature pertaining to pylon-aided mixing within scramjet isolators and combustors and observed its effectiveness over struts, ramps and cavities in fuel-air mixing and thrust performance. - Ran 2D flow simulations (steady, turbulent, supersonic, non-reacting fields, dual species) in ANSYS Fluent. Observed a significant rise in the fuel penetration depth into the free-stream in the presence of pylons.

projects.title: Conceptual Design of Business Jet
projects.description: - This team project focused on expanding on the concept of a mid-size business jet, including defining basic performance requirements like range (5000km), cruise Mach number (0.85), cruise altitude (40000ft) and design payload (1500kg). These requirements helped in performing trade studies to estimate the weight, wing and tailplane parameters, control surface dimensions and quantities including specific thrust and wing loading.- This was followed by creation of a CAD model of the jet, conducting aerodynamic analysis through CFD for obtaining aerodynamic force and moment characteristics and construction of n-V diagrams for maneuver and gust cases.- The project concluded with location of center of gravity and longitudinal and lateral stability analysis for the aircraft.

projects.title: Flapping Wings Aerodynamic Analysis
projects.description: - Conducted Smoke-flow visualization of leading-edge vortices formed by a rigid pitching symmetric airfoil up to an amplitude of 30 degrees and frequency of 10Hz.- Worked on a two-dimensional transient simulation of low Reynolds number flow around a rigid thin pitching symmetric airfoil through application of dynamic meshing and User-defined functions in ANSYS FLUENT.- Studied the effect of leading-edge vortex frequency and pitching amplitude on the lift and drag magnitudes and related the same to unsteady lift generating mechanisms including wing-wake interactions, Magnus effect and added mass effect.
